info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 10:00AM EDT until April 7 at 8:03AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Carthage.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Blue River at Carthage.
* WHEN...Until Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Many local roads flood and are impassable to most vehicles. A few evacuations are necessary in southern parts of Carthage, extreme southern sections of Knightstown, eastern Raysville and a few rural areas of northwest Rush County. Used auto parts yard in Carthage is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Saturday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 100 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Henry, IN; Rush, IN; Shelby, IN
